subject: Re: Problems with assertEquals()
msgSnippet: Hi Robert, ... Great hint :-) - thank you so much! Now it works. I m not only new in JUnit but also new in Java ;-). I only have to write some new
messageBody:
Hi Robert,

> > But if I wanna test directly with "assertEquals()" it breaks:
> >
> > ----- snip -----
> > assertEquals("My Test", object1, object2);
> > ----- snap -----
>
> Can you post the code of your equals() method?
> Or step through the code in a debugger?
>
> My guess is that you did not write
> bool assertEquals(Object other)
> but
> bool assertEquals(MyClass other)
> Then in assertTrue(object1.equals(object2)) your method is called.
> To fit the assertEquals argument list, the arguments get converted
> to Object, and the original Object.equals(Object) is called.

Great hint :-) - thank you so much! Now it works.
I'm not only new in JUnit but also new in Java ;-).

I only have to write some new Equals(Object object)-Methods which use
my existing ones and then things will work like I expect them to do.


Daniel
